definition: to stand in a circle and watch
surname Wei
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

sentences.chinese: 圍觀者的讚美是施虐狂。

sentences.english: There were about four to five hundred people watching outside the court till the trail ended.
sentences.chinese: 至庭審結束，大約有四五百人在法院外圍觀。

sentences.english: He went to look after many people gathered.
sentences.chinese: 許多人圍觀後他也跑去看了。

sentences.english: People were standing around him and laughing, his mother was standing there in agony.
sentences.chinese: 圍觀的衆人嘲笑他，他的母親痛苦萬分。

sentences.english: Some were so furious that they attacked his car. The crowd was dispersed three hours later.
sentences.chinese: 有些憤怒的羣衆便開始砸他的車，吸引了近千人圍觀。

sentences.english: Below, the crowd was flinging coins at the jugglers.
sentences.chinese: 他們下面，圍觀人羣向雜耍藝人扔着硬幣。

sentences.english: In the police cordon the crowd gathered outside a lot.
sentences.chinese: 在警方封鎖線外聚集了不少圍觀羣衆。

sentences.english: Often I was urged on by the spectators-at least by some of them.
sentences.chinese: 在比賽時，常常有圍觀者爲我加油打氣。

sentences.english: The car attracted the interest of a horde of children.
sentences.chinese: 那輛車吸引了一大羣孩子圍觀。

sentences.english: The on-lookers all spat on the thief.
sentences.chinese: 圍觀者們齊向這個小偷身上吐唾沫。
圍觀者的讚美是施虐狂。

sentences.english: Case also attracted a large number of public falls curious onlookers.
sentences.chinese: 墜樓案也引來大批公衆好奇的圍觀。

sentences.english: The crowd of onlookers registered their concern and curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 圍觀的人羣十分關心和好奇。

sentences.english: Outside the hospital, onlookers discussed Mr Chen and his situation.
sentences.chinese: 醫院外，圍觀者討論着陳光誠和他的處境。
偵探們撤出來並驅散了圍觀者。

sentences.english: The Sha recentghai Daily reported that a Chinese neologism.
sentences.chinese: 上海日報報道說，一個漢語新詞“給力”，看看圍觀。

definition: to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to pass by or through
to post (an item on a forum)
to come in
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
upstairs/(Internet slang) previous poster in a forum thread
original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
handsome guy/lady-killer/handsome (form of address)
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
surname Zu
to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries
(it's) no wonder (that...)/(it's) not surprising (that)
online friend/Internet user
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
hurriedly/without delay
crazy/frantic/extreme popularity
